alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 14 at 1:24PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: .A cold front will be passing through the area Monday afternoon and evening, resulting in convective storms capable of producing heavy rainfall and flash flooding conditions into the early overnight hours Monday night. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Colorado and east central Colorado, including Fremont, Teller, and El Paso Counties. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A cold front will be passing through the area Monday afternoon and evening, resulting in convective storms capable of producing heavy rainfall and flash flooding conditions into the early overnight hours Monday night. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft
